title: Gruen host Wil Anderson reveals why he is so private about his personal life
text:
He once 'drunk six beers at North Bondi RSL' on a date with Nicole Kidman.

But on Thursday, comedian Wil Anderson revealed exactly why he keeps his life hidden from the public eye.

Speaking to Who, the Gruen host, 45, said he intentionally avoids sharing details about himself to keep his private and public lives separate.

'I feel uncomfortable talking about myself': Comedian and Gruen host Wil Anderson reveals he is uneasy with 'celebrity' status and strives to keep personal life private

'I feel uncomfortable talking about my self and my private life and my world,' Wil told the publication.

'That is very important to me to keep that separate. I like the idea of being able to get good projects that I enjoy doing, but the celebrity aspect that comes with that is not something that particularly sits comfortably with me.'

The comedian explained that he would rather be known for projects like Gruen, his Wilosophy podcast and Triple M Hot Breakfast rather than his private life.

Low profile: Wil said that being a celebrity 'doesn't sit comfortably with him' despite hosting the wildly popular ABC show Gruen

In 2003, Wil went on a date with Academy Award-winning actress Nicole Kidman at North Bondi RSL club.

'We had six beers between us and I payed for all of them because apparently you can't get change for a million dollar note!' Wil joked on The Project in 2015.

Despite brushing shoulders with Australia's most famous actress, Wil insisted the celebrity life was not for him.

Famous friend: In 2003, Wil went on a date with Academy Award-winning actress Nicole Kidman (left) at North Bondi RSL club

'I've had friends who are celebrities beyond people knowing what they do,' he told Who, adding that it is a 'difficult level of public awareness' to handle.

Wil's show Gruen, formerly The Gruen Transfer, returned to screens for its eleventh season at the end of September.

Gruen airs on ABC on Wednesday at 8:30pm
